text: Interesting take with sweetness and a touch of sour. Standard style can barely be tasted, but very oddly done. Brown color and medium mouth. Tap

750 ml bottle

A little unusual, this bottle mixes the typical dunkelweiss profile with an earthy bit of truffle and walnut. The results provide a pleasant experience which demonstrates the mastery that Perennial has when they put their minds to a style.

Aroma / Appearance - A fluid base might be a little thin bodied. The fast fading ivory head gives some contrast though. Chocolate, truffles, black walnuts, and malt radiate upwards with an ephemeral feel that takes a minute or two to dissipate.

Flavor / Palate - Bubbly cola, black walnut, and dry woody textures of a forest floor sneak into the corners of the mouth. Taking the style in a new direction the profile manages to mix traditional with experimental in a way that makes me wish I had another pour available.
A very nice dunkel. Im not sure what the walnuts add as I dont detect any nuttiness, but its got a great, mellow sweetness. Dark brown with a thick head, sweet aroma.
Earthy with plum esters. Obvious walnut flavor and other biscuit malts and crisp lager like character. Presence of malts and earth mellow hops.great beer.

Tasted in July 2013 from a capped 750mL bottle that Adam and I picked up during a baseball trip in St. Louis. Pours clear cola brown with an average tan head that leaves fizzy, average lace. The nose is burnt caramel malt with a light candied walnut aroma. The flavor is a bit lighter, more nuts, with just a touch of spice and some toasted cocoa nib malt. The body is light and fizzy with a long caramel and candied nut finish.

There was just something soo real and earthy about this beer that i absolutly loved. Walnut is the pefect nut to compliment and it appears you just need to put a lot of it in to really pull out the goodness.

Bottle... Poured dark brown with a big, light tan head. Probably past its prime here. Lots of attenuation and sweet, fruity, esters and yeast presence. Dark fruits with a hint of walnut. Not my favorite from these guys but still unique, drinkable offering.

Bottle at home for Pats Thursday night game. Pours dark with big three finger head that slowly dissipates. Nose is red berry and dark fruits as well as malt. Tastes of walnut for sure, some cran raspberry, Asian plum sauce, malty, tobacco, and wheat. Nice lively and smooth palate. Leather palate in very nice way.
Dark brown color, fluffy beige head with good retention and solid lacing. Aroma of caramel brownies. Taste is nutella on toast. Nice.
Sweet, murky, robust, tart. Blueberries and Belgian quad with a refreshing palate of a dunkel. Tastes old and aged, complex, but also sweet and crisp.

Bottle... Pours murky and brown with a small, frothy, khaki head. Decent retention. The bouquet is a malty swirl of caramel, toasted nuts and milk chocolate. Medium to full-bodied with fizzy carbonation. The flavor is nutty and a hint chocolaty with a mild component of awkward, lactic acidity. Finishes tangy and sweet. Infected? Bottle supplied by biggsbowler!

Pours dark amber. Nice sweet nose. A good take on a dunkel style with malty walnut. 

--- RATED

750ml bottle in a teku. Pours very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate/darker malts, some light notes of wheat and walnuts, some caramel and toffee notes, and light dough. Flavor doesnt blend perfectly. Average texture. A pretty good beer.
Cherry cola, medium sour, some nutty, earthy malts. Not as rich as I hoped, but drier and drinkable.
Draft. Medium brown, cloudy to murky, thin head. Soft palate medium carbonation light finish.
Aromas of sweet red berries, red fruit. Pretty sweet smell and taste as well, at first sip. Earthy, woodsy. Round and smooth. Candied nuts.

Aromas of cherry, red berry, flora, cereal, hay. Hazy bronze, mostly lasting off-white head. Mostly dry, flavors mostly reflect the aromas, nutty, a lot of cereal. Light-medium bodied, smooth, dry finish.

Bottle thanks to Alemax. Pours brown with fine khaki head, settles quickly with minimal lacing. Aroma is toffee, caramelized sugar, and nutty malt, fairly sweet, wheat, banana and yeast. Flavor is toasted, nutty malt up front, caramelized sugar, wheat, with a sweet, toasted, toffee, nutty finish and mild toasted, wheat aftertaste. Soft to moderate carbonation, medium body, and very lightly chewy texture.

Bottle 750ml. [ As Perennial Black Walnut Dunkel ].Clear medium to dark brown - red amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, chocolate, caramel, nutty - walnut, tart notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a average to long duration, walnut, chocolate, dark malt. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140201]

[Tap] Pours a hazy shade of brown with a rocky cap of light brown head. Sweet and nutty aroma. Mild clove and yeast carries over to the flavor. Caramel malts, walnut, clove, nutmeg, fig and some banana notes throughout. Sweet and somewhat cloying finish. Fortunately, this doesnt detract much from the beer. Tasting notes from 2/2014.

750 ml bottle thanks to my winter secret santa, jckp64. Pours dark reddish-brown with a small creamy head that just sits and lingers. Aromas are dark fruit jam, walnuts, caramel, and dark bread. Tastes a bit funky. Dark fruit takes over but theres a light funky sourness that doesnt seem like it should be there. Kinda masks all the other flavors too. Barely get any walnuts or caramel in the taste. Medium body but the foamy carbonation gives it a big mouthfeel. Good aroma but disappointing taste.

750 ml bottle poured a clear reddish brown with a lasting tan head. Aromas of black walnuts, wheat, caramel and toffee. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of caramel, black walnuts, toffee and wheat with a smooth lingering caramel finish.

Draft at Lost Doge Dunn Loring. Poured a dark brown color with a off-white head. Aroma was dark fruits, raisin, nutty brown toasted notes. Flavor was dark fruits, nutty and sweet roasted malts. This beer was quite tasty.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, dark reddish brown, almost black pour with creamy khaki head, aroma brought notes of big nutty notes, hints of caramel, toffee, lots of dark fruit, some astringent notes with a hint of almost a cocoa powder note. Taste is a mix of dark cocoa, raisin, plum, dark fruits into a bit of nuts, nice caramel, toffee in there, finishing fairly sweet, slightly bitter. This is tasty, pretty well done.

Bottle thanks to RobertDale! Pours ruby brown with a large tan head that dissipates quickly, puffy lacing on the glass. Aroma is nutty - black walnut is really apparent here, along with caramel and rye bread. Flavor is the same, light sweet, light bitter, light astringency. Highly carbonated, medium body.
Has a soy sauce aroma and a foamy brown head with a dark opaque color. Smooth flavor with lots of malt and a sweet finish.

Bottle at Yesprs - thanks!! It pours lightly hazy deep brown with a small off-white head. The nose is toasty, caramel, walnut, honey, earth, wood and brown sugar. The taste is dark fruit, raisin, sultana, nut, caramel, wood, vinous, plum and cherry skin. Medium body and prickly carbonation. All comes together rather well. Interesting and pretty tasty.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Taste sweet, dark fruits, nutty. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Yesprs - Thanks. Cloudy brown - offwhite head. Roasted, nutty, wheaty, acid, ryebread, high malty, bitterness, candy, caramel, ripe fruits.

Draft at MBK. Pours a dark brown color with a large foamy tan head. Decent head retention. Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, mild chocolate, nuts, raisin. The taste is sweet malts, raisin, mild nuts. The taste is sweet malts, raisin, mild nuts, brown sugar and citrus. Medium bodied.

Bottle @ yespr. Pours a dark amber brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy nutty aroma with hints of caramel. Fruity wheat malty spicy nutty caramel flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy nutty caramel finish.

Sample from 75 cl. bottle. Pitch black with a dense, tanned head. Fruity aroma with caramel malts, yeasts - banana and nuts. Taste is sweet. Medium body with a creamy texture. Finishes light sweet with fruits. Nice.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */s - fuzzy brown coloured pour with small beige head. Sweet caramel malty, some brown sugar, slight nutty. Decent.

Bottled. A dark brown beer with a thin tan head. The aroma has notes of walnuts, roasted malt, over ripe fruits, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of over ripe fruits, malt, brett, and wood, leading to a bitter finish.

Flaske, 75 cl, hos Yespr. Uklar mahagoni-farvet med et lyst beige-farvet skum. Maltet næse. Mere fylde og karakter i smagen. Nogle næsten ristede, let kaffe-agtige noter. Nødder, brød. Perfekt karboneret. Frugtig, let bitter finish.
Bottled. Dark amber coloured. Dense light brown head. Aroma. Caramel, ripe fruits, sweetness. Flavour. ripe fruits, sweetness, light herbs, caramel. Medium bodied. Ends sweet and fruity.
Bottle. Hazy brown colour with a small head. Aroma and flavour of malt, fruit, yeast and walnuts.

bottle at yespr cloudy brown, small light brown head.
aroma is slightly sweet, mild faint nuts.
falvor is nutty, sort of sweet almonds, caramel , malts.

Bottle. Hazy dark brown with a small dissipating tan head. Red candy, caramel, banana, light wort, nuts. Medium body, medium sweet and light bitter, a bit high carbonation and a little thin. Wallnut schmallnut.
75 cl bottle. Pours hazy brown with a fully gone head. Aroma is spiced, mild citric and toasted malt. Sweet malty and caramelish. Nutty, sweet caramelish. Sweet and caramelish finish.

(750ml bottle) Pours an amber-brown body with a medium beige head. Aroma of nuts, roasted grain, cookie dough, and maple. Flavor of nuts, cocoa, roasted malt, caramel, banana, and caramel with a moderately dry finish.
Bottle. Tart black walnut aroma. Deep chestnut with a small off-white head. Fruity black walnut, toasty wheat malt flavor. Medium full body, soft carbonation. Definitely black walnut.
750 at markus'. Pours brown red. Aroma is Carmel brown nut. Taste is clean light nut brown. Finish is quick clean more same. Mouthfeel is very light.

Deep brown with a tan head.
Walnut, vanilla aroma.
Flavour is intense black walnut, malt....
Very natural, if ooverdriven, taste of real nuts....
Thick, sweet..ice cream topping worthy.

Dunkelweizen is my favorite style. Black Walnut Dunkel has an incredibly intense sourness blended with a fruity sweetness and rich maltiness that makes this beer absolutely unique. The best way I could describe it is as a triple dunkelweizen. This beer proves that US craft brewers can create original, superior beers,

Draft at Capones. Pours an opaque medium brown with some head that fades. nose is mild banana and plantains with yeast notes. firs sip is similar with a mild acetic and napthelene. finish is clean and rather nice.it would be better without the napthelene.

Bottle. Strong black walnut, banana, and wheat malt aroma. Cloudy brown with giant light tan head. Bittersweet black walnut, banana, and wheat malt flavor - cant really get anything else - the black walnut dominates. A well made beer, but black walnut is such a dominant flavor that it overwhelms much of the subtler weizen characteristics.
BWD is rich, complex and fruity. I really like the flavor and a touch of bitterness from the walnuts, but there is a bit more sweetness than I would like.
pours dark brown with a thick offwhite head. aroma of brown sugar, nuts, chocolate and honey. Taste follows, true to the style yet with a lot more flavor. very interesting.

some fruity esters, banana. some sweetness in the nose. dark brown color. really complex flavors -- earthy. knowing it has walnuts in it makes me think that im tasting them, but very subtle. unique, interesting beer.

Bottle at home. Pours clear brown with a small, creamy beige head, long retention with spare lacing. Aroma is lightly acetic grapes and raisins, cookie, toast, and caramel malt, black walnuts and earthy hops. Flavor is sour dark fruits, acetic, moderate sweet malt, light hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation. This is not a bad beer, but it is also not a Dunkelweizen, as advertised - possibly infected bottle?

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 26.06.2013, tap @ The Pony Bar NY:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is kind of strange fruity, caramel, nuts, yeast, chocolate, dough, toast, very ripe banana, coffee, grass. Taste is slightly roasted, dark malts, toast, burnt caramel, grass, very ripe banana, chocolate, roasted nuts, oak, wet hay, coffee. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Very strange dunkel weizen, but its also kind of interesting.

Sweet, nutty nose, maple, brown surgery sweetness that is balanced with slight acidity and nice hoppy backbone. Lighter mouthfeel than one might expect. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A hazed brown dunkel with a thin mocha head. In aroma, sweet nutty fruity malt with scotch barrel, walnut, dark fruits. In mouth, a sweet fruity banana with nutty notes, light solvent, alcohol warmth, ok.

I had this beer at Isaac Newtonsto kick off Philly Beer Week. I LOVE Dunkel, but this beer did not do it for me. Perhaps it was due to the fact that I had just had Fantastic Voyage Coconut Porter? Not sure. Either way, it did not taste like a Dunkel to me

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a weizen glass. Pours translucent chestnut brown with big fluffy beige head. Some lacing, light body, medium carbonation, and tart aroma. Taste is estery banana, rich tart, some black walnuts, and a hint of earthyness which peaks out from time to time. This is good, original, and may be the best dunkleweizen I have had.

My only previous "nut" beers have been the nut brown ales.  Not a fan at all.  This one was suprisingly decent.  Nice sweet and tart finish.  Slightly nutty and malty dunkel flavor.  By no means a favorite but enjoyable.
On draft at Isaacs. Maybe Isaacs received a batch or something. Mine was very very flat...no carbonation at all. However, I liked the nut, earth, and toasted flavors.

Location: Draft at Blind Tiger, 4/8/13


Aroma: The nose has banana, some sweet malts, brown sugar, earth, and nuts

Appearance: This one pours a brownish-red color with a beige head

Flavor: The flavor is much the same as the nose, it leans sweet, with a lot going on 

Palate: This one has a medium body and a pretty decent mouthfeel as well

Overall Impression: 
This was some interesting and nice stuff.  Im glad to have tried it, it is quite unique and worth trying for sure.
Rather enjoyed this one, on tap at Marias in Chicago. Very balanced toffee, nut, and generously malted dunkelweizen. Very impressive.
4 oz sample at Waldo Pizza.  Pours a dark black.  Aroma of black walnuts, caramel, raisin, peat.  Flavor is much sweeter than I imagined.  Black walnut, raisin, molasses, peat.

~12 oz draft pour at Martin City Brewing Company in Kansas City, Missouri.  The pour is dark brown, block with a 1/2 inch tan head.  Nice lacing left behind on the glass.  The aroma is big on the walnut, along with malt sweetness, some brown sugar and a hint of the Dunkel yeast.  The taste is the nose, big on the walnut, the sweetness of brown sugar and malt, and lightly leafy earth soft herbal banana yeast.  The palate is light to medium bodied, soft carbonation, and a dry nutty earthy finish.  Surprised by how much walnut character this showed.  Nice beer.
On tap.  Pours a dark brown with red highlights and a small tan head.  Aroma is walnut, caramel, and dark chocolate.  Taste is nutty with some sweet caramel and a little hop bitterness.

Bottle. Pours a deep brown with thin tan head and some lace. Nose of sweet and tart dark fruits - black cherry, plum, and brown sugar, walnuts, candi sugar, caramel.  Light body, well carbonated. Finish is slightly tart with some roasted malts.
Draft at Torst. Pours brown with a beige head. Nutty malts and medium sweetness, with lighter fruity banana notes. Pretty easy to put back.

Bottle - 750mL crowned. Very dark cola-colored brown. Short tan head atop it. Aroma is nutty and chocolaty with an earthy note to it and hints of dark fruit. Taste is toasted malt, chocolate covered nuts, earthy hops, roasted banana, dark fruit and caramel. Body is medium with soft, bubbly carbonation feel on the palate. Ends with more chocolate covered nuts, chocolate banana, caramel, toasted malt, and earthy hops.

Draft at Baileys range. Pours brown with a half inch of Khaki foam. Leaves a bit of lacing. Has the walnut notes On the nose along with some of the yeast. Has a but of the bubble gum mixed with the nuts. Its almost like a black cherry. I dont know who thought to pair these two but theyre fucking delicious.

This beers aroma has a strong black walnut profile with toasted malts and banana coming through as well, and the appearance was a reddish dark brown with a small, white, and foamy head. The taste was mildly sweet, slightly umami, and a touch sour, which was really enjoyable, and the palate combined a medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation, and an abrupt finish.
Aromatics were slightly sour in note. Taste was malty, caramel and nutty. Overall lots of carbonation and a solid palate.

750 bottle from Capones.  Pours turbid dark brownish black with fizzy tan head.  Nose is earthy nutty and brown sugary, with notes of fig, raisin, and fine tobacco.  Tastes earthy, complex with a HUGE walnut flavor, brown sugar, vienna-ish malt, and a nutty brown sugary molassesy finish.  This one is rock solid.

Nutty banana clove roast nose.  Pours hazy brown off white head. Flavors of banana nuts darker wheat malts. Smooth soft yeasty spice finish. Nice lively carbonation. Easy drinking and flavorful. Thanks foppa!

750ml bottle.  Aroma of roasty, chocolate malt, some fruity, spicy yeast esters, nut (walnut, hazelnut), caramel, dark brown sugar and faint vanilla.  Clear deep brown in color, head is fine and lasting.  Nutty, roasty, lightly sweet malt dominates, with more brown sugar, hazelnut, toffee, bread, and more peppery, spicy yeast showing up at the finish, along with a certain tanginess in the background.  Smooth mouthfeel and low in effervescence, body is medium-full.  Very nicely balanced and tasty.
April 17, 2013 - tap at Soha. Muddy brown pour with nice head that lasted and lacing. Aroma was malt, banana, clove and nutty. Taste was consistent with aroma and had a nice nutty finish.

Tap - big foamy head, dark amber color, sweet malty raisiny aroma an flavor, mild hops, 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Bainbridge Street Barrel House in Philly. Pours a dark brown with three fingers of light tan head that recedes into a dense cap with no lacing. Big aromas of chocolate, cocoa powder, nuts, and sweet malt.  The flavor is also a bit sweet at first, with flavors of dates, bubblegum, and some dark fruits. Some nutty and roasty flavors follow by some biscuity breadiness. A mild hop profile sneaks in athe the end to balance things somewhat. The feel is on the lighter side of medium bodied with a nice amount of carbonation.

On tap at Tørst with Max, Ramy, GT & Whitney, Andy, Pearl, James, J-Dad, blipp and Ashley.  Pours a lightly hazed amber brown with a thin white head.  Smells of sticky old bananas.  Chewy malt and even more bananas.  What is this, a banana bread with walnuts?  Is that why its called black walnut?  Bananas!  More bananas, chewy old banana bread that has dried out while sitting on the table waiting for someone to eat it.  I guess its drinkable, but Im glad I borrowed this glass from blipp and didnt have to drink it by myself.

This one poured a medium brown color with a beige head.  Aroma was light nuts, light roast and grassy hops.  Falvor was similar, somewhat bitter, but not seemingly from the hops, Ok but not too great.

Poured a hazy brown.  Nice carbonation.  Smell of malt and yeast , wheat and roasted nuts

Flavor was malt with a nutty after taste, slight tartness with a porter body.  Very nice style, refreshing while having depth

Draft at Torst. Pours opaque brownish black with thin tan head. Aroma is some sort of nuttiness, hard to place. Taste is slightly walnut, slightly bitter and earthy. Finish is weirdly bitter and lingers. Have to say I was looking forward to this and was fairly disappointed.  The flavor profile didnt work for me and the finish lingered bitterly.

Pours a murky light brown with little head and no lacing.  Aroma of banana bread with figs and dates and over ripe fruit.   Sweet taste of sorghum with nutty flavor and a bit of tartness.  Earthy.  Thin mouthfeel and watery body.  

---Jeremy H

2013 bomber to a snifter.  Pours a hazy amber brown with a little tan head.  Aroma is a funky sorghum smell, a little sweet and a little earthy.  Taste is sweet  like the sorghum smell,  some malt.  The walnut taste is definitely there and contributes to the earthiness.  Some fig or raisin with banana bread.  Thin, wet mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750 ml. bottle. Pours very dark brown with a tan head that quickly disappears. Aroma is roasted malt, nuts, syrup. Finishes slightly sweet.

Tap, pours dark brown, nearly black with tan head and great sporadic lacing. Aromas/flavor of plum, dark fruit, sweet malts, and very light walnut. Wish there was more in there. Very belgian tasting got a german style. Overall, still a nice brew from Perennial.

On tap half pint at Gilly's Craft Beer & Wine in Rockville, MD. 

Murky to opaque, walnut brown with a small khaki head and excellent lacing that unfortunately does not linger. 

Aroma of walnut, maple, caramel, yeast and toffee.

Taste of sweet dark fruit, citrus, roasted malt, brown sugar, nuts and lots of toffee and caramel at the finish.

Medium/light body and medium/high carbonation.

This a very interesting beer.  The aroma does not tip off the sweet fruity and malty flavor.  They have done a great job of extracting the walnut essence, especially the aromas.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at the brewpub.  Comes dark brown with a nice tan head.  Aroma of malt, nuts, fruit, and spice.  Taste is malt, nuts, fruits, spice, and a bit of chocolate.  Good stuff!

750mL capped bottle.  Bottled on 2/2013.  I have to admit this was pretty damn delicious, was not expecting.  I will also add I had no idea this was a wheat beer and was surprised to read that on the bottle.  I got no esters in this beer.  General a clean, slightly earthy maltiness.  Has a mild and cool sweet, not sugary aspect that I could only attribute to the walnuts.  I really liked it.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Faint walnut and very mild chocolate and dark fruit in the nose. Very mild. Flavor a bit more pungent. A little more walnut and more fruits.

Draft.  Dark brown body with small beige head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, walnut, some caramel, light nut sourness.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, some nut, light raisin.  Light-medium body, light stickiness.
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2013 Pours dark brown, aroma is walnuts, toffee, bread. Taste is definitely roasted walnuts, banana bread, toffee and chocolate..nice rich flavor unique and awesome beer

Tap at Churchkey. Pours muddy dark red, larger tan head. Big lace. Nose is heavy banana esters, some overly ripe banana with vanilla ice cream. Taste is not too sweet, some mineral water body, mild chocolate syrup, ripe banana dessert. Good, but walnut addition could go unnoticed. My best guess is that it manifests itself in a slightly richer fatty mouthfeel.
Draft at Churchkey. Brown/plum pour with small white head. Nose and flavor of raisin, date, fig, beautiful sweet nut but well attenuated. Smooth and delicious.

Pours a hazy amber with a white head. Spicy smell, mainly nutmeg, cinnammon, and clove. It has a fruity, spicy flavor. It almost tasted like a pumpkin ale to me. It was very enjoyable and smooth Loved it

Draft at Jerrys. Dark brown with, big, flotsam, tan head, fine legs / Sweet, candied (Jolly Rancher) nose of black walnut, toast, and molasses / Medium body, a touch thin, moderately sweet & inky, some lively carbonation, malty with some hop balance, and lightly bitter finish / Simple, clean flavors of black walnut, cocoa, clove, and cream / Seems to cry out for a bigger, and hoppier, body.

750mL bottle. Pours a murky dark brownish color, decent head retention. Nose is malty, some of those black walnuts mentioned on the label, funky yeast and bubblegum.  Mouth is medium bodied, pleasantly malty up front with some nuttiness, then toffee, bubblegum and baby powder (wtf?). Overall decent dunkel, albeit a tad watery.
Poured from tap a medium red brown with khaki head. Aroma of walnuts, with hints of banana bread. Tastes of sweet malt, banana bread, roasted walnuts,
Really nice dark beer. Pours like a Guinness. I got a nice coffee flavor out of it, with a finish of toasted nuts. Definitely worth drinking again

Dark brown coloured body with a thick, four centimetre tall tan head that fades like soda and even makes the same noise (fizz). Aroma of toasted malt, alcohol, soap, cleanser, yeast and a hint of nuts (walnuts, I guess). Medium-bodied; Nice malty flavour with some subdued pit fruit sweetness from raisins and prunes with a hint of nuttiness at the end and perhaps a little bit of light spices such as allspice and nutmeg. Aftertaste has a good balance of malt and sweetness with the alcohol showing a touch, but not overdone by that or the nuttiness. Overall, a decent beer - but not as good as I was expecting nor representative of the style at all. This is a classic Dunkles not a Dunkleweizen at all - Im not sure how that was misrepresented. I sampled this 75 cL bottle purchased from New Beer Distributors in New York, New York on 04-July-2012 for US$12.25 sampled at home as the first beer of the new year on 01-January-2013 here in Washington.

Something was a little off for me. Bottle. Poured a light brown color with a tiny off white head. Left lacing on side of the glass. Aroma was nutty, with coffee and nuts. Flavor was woody, nutty, malty and had a very smooth finish to it. I dont know if I had a bad bottle, something just didnt seem right.
Deep red-brown with a diffuse tan head. A nutty, malty aroma with hints of sourdough. Unrest alcohol and dark malt, and just a bit of walnut bread in the finish.
Bottle with Andrew and brendan at ginger man. Pours a deep brown body. Aroma is delicious nut, spice, cardamom. Mouthfeel is medium to thin with notes of nut and light roast.

750ml and served in a Duvel snifter: Pours a medium brown hue with a mostly lasting frothy off-white head and little lace. The aroma has notes of rustic caramel and toffee malts, some red wheat and char, very heavy walnut  and plum vapours along with a dash of black pepper. The taste is malt forward as expected with a utterly nutty and earthy overtone. Rich caramel and light fruity tones as well. What I would have like to have seen is a bit of the weizen yeast character which would have added depth IMO. The mouth feel is lively  and medium-bodied with a sticky finish. Overall a solid dunkel but leans far to much towards that side and not enough weizen character for me. I could buy again, a nice fall/football brew.
Bottle shared at Brad Fest 2012 in Minneapolis, MN.  Pours a deep brown color with white head.  Dark malts, sweet, walnut flavors.

Bottle @ Brads house Minneapolis, courtesy of jcnielsen. Pours a clear reddish orange appearance with a light brown head. Nutty, caramel, toasty malty, a touch fruity, a bit bready aroma. Somewhat spicy, nutty, caramel/chocolate, a bit yeasty flavor. Interesting but nothing super special.
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is sweet caramel, roast nuts, and raisins. Flavor is toast, nutty, chocolate, some light coffee, earthy dark fruit and a little bitterness.

I grew up in Missouri with black walnut ice cream, and the essence of it is definitely in this beer. It adds a creamy and somehow fruity impression to the malty flavor and mellow bitterness, and overall I found the beer a bit sweeter than Id like. But it brought back memories of my grandparents farm, walking through the orchards, crunching shells underfoot with my cousins. Evocative.

25.4 oz bottle.  Dark brown with a tan wisp.  Nose is molasses and banana with hints of tobacco.  Medium body with a tang.  Quite sweet; sassafras, clove, honey and root beer.  Walnut comes out in the finish adding a slight bitterness.  Nice dessert sipper.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle into weizen glasses.

Pours a dark brown with a two finger beige head. No visible lacing. A pleasing aroma with notes of banana, cocoa, subtle spice, and earthiness. Opens with subtle toffee and cocoa joined by nutty banana bread, and finishes smooth with mild earthiness. Lighter-side of medium bodied. The level of carbonation is perfect, pleasant, but not in a way that disrupts the silky, smooth mouthfeel. The black walnuts really add a new dimension to an excellent dunkelweizen base. Another excellent brew from Perennial. They have yet to disappoint.

The beer pours a brown color with a tan head. The aroma is full of toffee and walnuts, two notes that really go well together in this case. The flavor is very similar. I get a lot of sweet toffee and brown sugar notes, with some walnuts and chocolate also thrown in. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Very well done and very enjoyable.

4 ounce sampler at Bridge Tap House in St. Louis.  Dark brown color and gentle roasted walnut aroma.  Sweet, nutty, hardy, and unusual.  I liked this stuff and its fantastic with a meal containing duck.  Its earthy and medium-to-heavy bodied.  Satisfying and soothing.

Pours unclear dark cherry wood with a tan head. The aroma is sweet, soft walnuts dominating from all those pounds added and a little vanilla. The flavors bring soft sweet walnuts as well, dying with a flat malty sweetness.

750ml bottle.
Deep reddish brown with an off-white head.  Aromas of nuts, chocolate, and dark fruit - flavors of walnuts, coffee, and just the right sweetness.
bottle, dark red velvet color, nice foam, aroma and flavor have great depth of walnut, cashew and chocolate, coffee grounds, silky finish
(750ml bottle) clear rich ruby-copper, ran bubbles soda-like head. Nose of walnut, caramel, raisins, honey. Taste of nuts, toasty, honey, soda-like carb, sweet linger.

My favorite beer of the night. You dont often find good Dunkelweizens being made out there. This is a big exception. Medium bodied lovely beer. Great varied flavor profile. Nice mellow nuttiness. Earthy walnuts. Soft dark fruits. Rich but very drinkable. Made with a deft hand.
Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Nose and taste of black walnut, ripe banana, cocoa and dark fruits. Medium body.

Draft at Fountainhead. This is pretty much not a dunkelweizen, just to put that out there. Pours near black with a frothy offwhite head. Nose is toasty and nutty, lacks weizen character. Improves as it warms. On tasting, dry and nutty with earthy notes, balanced hop bitterness with the walnuts. Some slickness on the palate as well, really nice beer that improves. Some cocoa on the finish. Really nice.

On tap.  Pours an opaque dark brown with a thin light tan head.  Has a slightly sour aroma.  Taste is smooth with chocolate and coffee evident as well as a little tart/sour character.  Somewhat nutty; very good effort.

On tap at Fountainhead (Chicago, IL). Pours a rich deeper brownish pour, firm haziness, light glowing notes. A cakey light brown is moderated sized, sticks around ok. Aromas gentle nutty elements, touches of brown malts, earthy, a touch of fruity quality. Toast, mellow toffee, and biscuits. Initial is medium bodied, perhaps a touch lighter, with touches of carmelization, cocoa, and faint kiss of anise. Some good earthy nutty qualities, touches of toasted earth, faint cocoa, and the inevitable caramel bit. Mellow kiss of banana, the esters are farther back than youd think fairly light. More darkness than fruit. Middle is gentle dryness, some sticky body, really still staying fairly balanced, just a kiss of dark fruit but earthy overall. Mellow black olive, dark fruit, caramel, touches of sticky malts, toast, and earth on the finish. It doesnt necessarily dry up, but it does stay fairly balanced, mellow body and touches of smoothness, gentle dark fruit. Faint toasty elements and carmelization. Pretty solid Dunkel, a fairly rich earthy element from the nuts, mellow fruity quality gives some touches of life. I enjoyed this.
Welp it smells like walnuts and has a dark roasty color. Light on the walnut flavors and a little thin being a lager. Not bad at all for a lager, I taste a saltiness but jakebra says no.
black walnuts are such a treat. 250 pounds sounds like a lot, but maybe try 500 next time? is that a black walnut leaf on the bottle cap?

On draft at Bigelos.  This beer poured a nice brown hue and no light penetrated.  An interesting nose that was vinous and nutty as was the flavor. Na really interesting dunkel.  Wheat notes with light chocolate and even some coca cola.  So much maltiness here, too.  Really nice.
750 from Wine and Cheese Place. Beautiful pour where the tan head sits on the black body. Very creamy. Ice cream like (as one person wrote here). Nice chocolate taste. Slight nutty taste. Excellent.

Capped 750 from Wine & Cheese in Clayton, MO. Pours very dark brown with a 2 finger foamy beige head. Aroma is actually walnut. Amazing. Also a bit of chocolate. Med body. Flavor is banana, chocolate and some black walnut. Know that, cause my mom was always bringing black walnut ice cream home. This is approaching complex and its pretty amazing. I can taste (virtually) black walnut ice cream. Joys of childhood. Not. I preferred chocolate. But I could go for some of that ice cream right now. Finishes pretty dry, with walnut flavor, and lingering banana. NIce.

It poured a light brown color with a small off-white head. The aroma was of nuts, some malts, and a little light wheat. The taste was of nuts, a little wheatiness, some spice and a little leafy.  A very good Dunkelweizen.

Some hints of dark malts in the aroma. Some yeast phenolics are there as well. Pours a deep mahogany color with a dense tan colored head that hangs around forever. Very nice flavor. The wheat malt gives this a nice creamy texture. It feels much more thick and rich than a typical dunkel weiss. The walnuts add a nice flavor that only enhances the richness of this beer. It marries well with the chocolaty flavor of the dark malts. This beer is definitely heavier than the base beer would suggest, not that this is a bad thing at all! It just is way more beefy than the 6.6% ABV on the bottle would lead you to believe. Another fine beer from the creative geniuses at Perennial!

Sampled at Urban Chestnuts Wolpertinger - 1st anniversary - Pours mahogany brown with a tan head.  The aroma has rich banana, full wheat, some walnut, mild clove and bubblegum.  Medium / full body with generous semi-soft carbonation.  The flavor starts like a drier version of the aroma with more of a black walnut presence.  The finish has rich nuttiness.  Nice take on a dunkelweizen.

Tap at brewpub.  Pour is murky light brown with a medium off-white head.  Aroma is light nutty malt, faint sweetness, light wheaty tartness, and a touch of spice.  Flavor is very true to nose with hints of whaet-like tartness and spice with notes of bubblegum, nuts, and light spice.  Solid offering.

Draft at the brewery. Pours a deep, dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of walnuts, bananas, dark and sweet malts, brown sugar, cola, and earthy notes. Flavor of walnuts, bananas, cola, toast, brown sugar, wheat, mild spices, and toffee. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet, nutty mouthfeel. Very very good for this style.
